abstract.para: This book covers the use of Mydigipass for Joomla package. It does not cover any other extension available on compojoom.com .

section.title: Introducing Mydigipass
section.para: Mydigipass.com™ is a security service aiming to protect your online identity. The service is developed by the VASCO® Data Security GmbH and through this documentation we will just call it Mydigipass API.
The Mydigipass package distributed through compojoom.com is a collection of modules and plugins that makes integrating the mydigipass API with your Joomla! site a breeze.
So what does mydigipass.com exactly do?

On typical Joomla! site, users login with email addresses and static passwords: something they know. Two-factor authentication adds something they have to the authentication process. If you install and configure the mydigipass package on your Joomla site, users will securely login by generating a OTP (one time password) using their authenticator by scanning a QR code with their mobile devices, authenticating via the embedded DIGIPASS in Intel® IPT on their laptop, ob by using on of the digipass hardware tokens. The authenticator is what the user has and is the second authentication factor.

chapter.title: Installation and updates
chapter.para: Installing Mydigipass is no different than installing any other Joomla!™ extension on your site. You can read the complete instructions for installing Joomla!™ extensions on the official help page .Throughout this chapter we assume that you are familiar with these instructions and we will not duplicate them.

section.title: Getting the installation packages
section.para: The mydigipass package is located under Downloads -> Official releases -> Mydigipass. The releases are listed with the newest release always on top. Once you click on the release number you'll see the available files for download.
You can use the installation package to update from previous version as well; just install it, without uninstalling the old package.

note.para: The zip package includes all available modules and plugins. During the installation they will be installed automatically.

section.title: Installing a developer release
section.para: In normal cases you won't have to install developer releases. You are advised to go to the download area and grab the normal package as described in the past chapter. However there are situations where things are not working - if we confirm the problem, we fix it and generally release a developer release to test the fix. We proceed the same way with new features - we add them and create a developer release for those of you who like to experiment with them before the official release gets published.

To get the latest developer release navigate to Downloads -> Developer Releases -> Mydigipass. The latest release is always on top. Download the package and install it through the Joomla extension manager.

important.para: Please note: Having a backup is never a bad idea!

section.title: Checking for the latest version and upgrading
section.para: We use the standard Joomla update manager to notify you about updates. In your Joomla backend click on Extensions-> Extension Manager -> Update and click on Find updates.

section.title: Uninstall
section.para: You can uninstall the Mydigipass package just as any other Joomla extension. Just navigate to Extensions -> Extension Manager -> Manage -> search for Mydigipass (package), select it and click uninstall. The uninstall process will remove all installed plugins and modules as well.

chapter.para: If you've installed the mydigipass plugin as described in the past chapter then we've installed the following plugins and modules on your Joomla website

section.title: System - Mydigipass
section.para: This plugin handles the authentication against the mydigipass API and logs the user into your Joomla site. You'll need to configure it in order for it to communicate properly with mydigipass API.
The configuration options are as follow:

listitem.para: Enter the client id of your developer.mydigipass.com project.
Enter the client secret code of your developer.mydigipass.com project.
Copy the URI provided on the right into the options of your developer.mydigipass.com application.

If in sandbox mode you can test the plugin and make sure that everything works as expected. If you are ready to go live, then you need to request API credentials from mydigipass. Look for the Go live button in your developer.mydigipass.com account.

section.title: Mydigipass module
section.para: This module shows a "mydigipass.com secure login" button to non-logged in users. And "mydigipass.com connect" button to logged in users. If the user has already connected his profile you have the option to hide the module.

listitem.para: Determines whether or not to show information to a user who has his account already connected with mydigipass.com

section.title: Mydigipass admin module
section.para: This module shows a "mydigipass.com secure login" in the administrator section of the website.

note.para: To make use of this function as administrator you have to connect your account through the frontend first.
